Description: Egyptian terracotta female figure with hair worn back in 'melon style' wearing festival wreath headdress, following tanagra style. Mould-made. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Dark red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Similar 1st century BC (Bayer-Niemeier 1988, pl.2.9 no.15) and late 3rd century BC parallels (Török 1995, pl.116, nos 216 and 217) and an example from Memphis (Petrie 1909, pl.31.105-6). See also similar examples NA528, NA530 and NA536 from Naukratis (less so NA529 and NA532). 2nd century BC parallel from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2005, no. 193). Bayer-Niemeier, E. 1988. Liebieghaus Museum Alter Plastik. Bildwerke der Sammlung Kaufmann, 1. Griechisch-römische Terrakotten. Melsungen. Török, L. 1995. Hellenistic and Roman terracottas from Egypt. Roma. Petrie, W.M.F. 1909. The palace of Apries. Memphis volume III. London, School of Archaeology in Egypt. Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout..
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.416) (Phase 1)
Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 84, nos 94-123)
